name: Kepler 10b
description: Kepler-10b was the smallest transiting exoplanet known at the time of discovery and the first definitively rocky exoplanet identified by Kepler, distinguishing it from earlier candidates like CoRoT-7b, which had more uncertain compositions.

name: Corot 7B
description: CoRoT-7b was one of the first super-Earths confirmed to be rocky, predating Kepler-10b (which you asked about earlier). Its discovery marked a milestone in exoplanet research, demonstrating the ability to detect small, terrestrial worlds.

name: Ankaa (Alpha Phoenicis)
description: Ankaa is a spectroscopic binary system, meaning it consists of two stars orbiting each other with a period of about 10.5 years. The primary star is an evolved giant, and the companion is not directly observable but detected through spectral shifts.
